attributes.action: UK Government to hand control of the Severn bridges to the Welsh Assembly.
attributes.background: Control of the Severn bridges needs to be handed to the Welsh Assembly, who have unanomously voted to abolish the tolls. This would greatly help the Welsh economy.

attributes.action: Reduce or abolish university fees
attributes.background: The rising fee of University fees is leaving many students in massive debt or maybe even putting off the chance to attend higher education. this then leaves unbalance of social class such as the more well off students are attending whereas the less well off aren't able to.

attributes.action: Urgent review of Royal Navy capabilities, with immediate action on results.
attributes.background:
The Harrier Jet was scrapped by the UK in 2010, (USA will scrap them in 2025). Our last Aircraft Carrier was scrapped in 2016.
The replacement will enter service possibly in 2020.
I want our Government to immediately find a solution to this massive capability gap and implement it without delay.
attributes.additional_details:
The Harrier Jump Jet was scrapped in 2010 (USA will scrap them in 2025).  Our last Aircraft Carrier was scrapped in 2016.
No replacement has yet entered service. The MOD accountants have left this once great Maritime Nation defenceless. Utter madness to dispose of essential defence equipment before the replacement has been thoroughly trialled and allowed to enter service.
I want our Government to immediately find a solution to this massive capability gap and implement it without delay.

attributes.action: Introduce ecig workplace regulations to stop discrimination against vaping
attributes.background: Hundreds of workplaces are rightly, making policies to include ecigs. The trouble is that some policies are stating that vaping must be in smoking shelters. It is putting vapers at risk and forcing them off the premises to remain smoke free when the smokers have a shelter.
attributes.additional_details: Vaping is not smoking, therefore vapers should have their own rights and not be discriminated against or put at risk of passive smoking.

attributes.action: Amend the Trade Union Act 2016 to remove trade union immunity from damages.
attributes.background: RMT & ASLEF have been striking for no discernible aim other than to cause harm to the commuters that use Southern Rail. They have wreaked untold costs upon individuals, families & businesses, yet they have legal immunity from the laws that govern every other person & organisation in the country.
attributes.additional_details:
This advantage that gives unions legal immunity from any claims for damages arising from their behaviour, however destructive, is wrong. Even the government has been taken to court by an individual before being allowed to invoke article 50, yet someone that loses their job because of persistent union action has no recourse to the courts, it is unjust and unfair. 

Unjustifiable strikes must stop, unfair advantages must stop.
 
Please help to get the Trade Union Act 2016 amended and remove the unfair trade union immunity from damages.

attributes.action: Pay Special Guardianship carers the same rate as foster carers.
attributes.background: We both work full time jobs but almost 50% of my partners annual salary goes on child care cost. We should not have to be financially punished for wanting to work or cover the cost in traveling to arrange visits with the natural birth parents.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.communitycare.co.uk/2015/07/23/special-guardianship-orders-misused/

attributes.action: Freedom of movement for non-EU students during term time if no lectures missed
attributes.background: Overseas university students holding a Tiers 4 visa are technically not allowed to leave UK during term time even if they have no running modules, or they will take own risk at UK border. The university's authorised absence letter will never be approved except for emergency reason.

attributes.action: Make the police non emergency number 101 a freephone number.
attributes.background: Currently the cost of calling 101 is 15p per call, yet the similar non emergency number of the NHS 111 is free, this needs to be resolved as most people in the UK use mobile phones and mostly on contracts where their minutes wouldn't cover the 15p charge to report a crime.

attributes.action: Prioritise implementation of the alternative student finance product
attributes.background: Many Muslims are unable to attend university, because their faith prohibits them from taking interest based loans to fund tuition fees.The government has acknowledged this and have developed an alternative financing model.This needs to be made available so that more students can attend university
attributes.additional_details:
Links to previous developments;

2014 consultation
https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/349899/bis-14-984-government-response-to-a-consultation-on-a-sharia-compliant-alternative-finance-product.pdf

White Paper 2016
Page 56- Alternative student finance offer
https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/523546/bis-16-265-success-as-a-knowledge-economy-web.pdf

For information on developments visit
http://www.halalstudentloans.co.uk/

attributes.action: Introduce £50 charge for calling an ambulance for non-emergency conditions.
attributes.background: The answer to over-crowded A&E and queueing ambulances isn't more money, it is to stop people using ambulances as a taxi service or for minor ailments. The ambulance crews have to treat you if you call them but too many people are abusing this service. A charge for mis-use would cut own demand.

attributes.action: Ban vehicles greater than 7.5 tonnes from UK roads except between 8pm & 8am
attributes.background: The UK has a problem with its ageing road infrastructure that simply cannot cope with the volume of traffic that uses it on a daily basis. The volume of road traffic needs to be spread out across a 24 hour period, lorries greater than 7.5 tonnes should only be permitted to travel between 8pm and 8am
attributes.additional_details: The average daily commute has just increased to 2 hours and the general public is being forced to spend wholly unacceptable amounts of time in cars for what are often small journeys. Forcing drivers off the road through increased taxes or toll roads is not the answer. The answer is obvious but the government won't take the action required to tackle the problem. Road traffic needs to be spread out over the 24 hour period and allow vehicles greater than 7.5 tonnes to only travel between 8pm - 8am

attributes.action: Protect the NE-Derbyshire parliamentry constituency from boundary changes.
attributes.background: There has been proposed boundary changes around the UK, one including my local constituency 'North East Derbyshire', it's been proposed that the constituency be scrapped but replaced with two new ones, which obviously doesn't make sense and is completely unnecessary.
attributes.additional_details:
The proposed boundary changes are in a sense 'undemocratic', local residents vote for a candidate to represent their constituency as their local MP, but changes are confusing local residents and angering some.

My source for this information is local media and other sources, I recommend googling about it, to find more information to prove this.

attributes.action: Stop parking charges at hospitals for visitors & staff, charges for TV & phone
attributes.background: I have been in hospital several times, cost £1.60 per hr, £7.50 per day for TV, 3 minute phone call cost £2.00. I am an OAP and cannot afford these prices.
attributes.additional_details: Being old I am in and out of hospital

attributes.action: Make the laws protecting chickens apply to all birds including game birds
attributes.background: The suffering of game birds being bred in tiny wire cages for shooting estates on the One Show BBC1 31 October 2016 is sickening. Birds were breaking their necks bashing their heads against the wire roofs of their tiny cages whilst trying to escape. They are then wrongly sold as free range.

attributes.action: Stop putting the clocks forward for British Summertime (BST) leave UK on GMT
attributes.background: The clocks changing for British Summertime started 100 years ago. The UK did this when Germany started doing it, apparently it was to save coal. Farmers have lights on their tractors and lights in their cattle sheds so this only serves to cause a nuisance for most of us. Especially those with kids

attributes.action: Create specialist knife crime units within the police.
attributes.background: In areas that have high levels of knife crime. Specialist knife crime units need to be created within the police, to tackle this ongoing issue.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.birminghammail.co.uk/news/midlands-news/black-october-knife-crime-after-12086384.amp

attributes.action: Never sign a trade deal like CETA/TTIP which cede UK sovereignty to corporations
attributes.background: Once Brexit has completed, the UK will be able to enter into trade deals by itself. Ministerial support for TTIP/CETA which are aimed at eroding national sovereignty and giving multinational corporations the right to sue governments if policy adversely effects their profits is a serious danger.
attributes.additional_details: The main tenet of the Brexit campaign was to "take back control" from the EU. UK ministers have voiced strong support for CETA/TTIP which seems contradictory given that such trade deals put the sovereignty of government in doubt and give corporations the ability to sue governments under Investor-State Dispute Settlement powers before special international tribunals. This would effectively bring an end to the cherished principle of equality before the law, all in the name of greater profits.

attributes.action: Legalise the possesion and use of tasers within the security industry.
attributes.background: In the security industry there are certain situations where security staff are unable protect themselves, Innocent bystanders, Assets. Due to individuals being agressive who cant be controlled by using conventional methods or a indavidual with a weapon, Bladed article or a possible firearm etc.
attributes.additional_details:
Each year there is numerous deaths and assaults within the security industry, Which could of been avoided with the use of a taser.

We understand that the use of a taser would be the very last resort. However we believe tasers would prevent such agression just by being a visual deterrent.
Monitoring tasers:
Anyone possesing a taser would need adequate training.
Body cameras to be used in conjuction with tasers to show taser was correctly drawn/used.

Police are the front line but so are we.

attributes.action: Make Armistice Day 2018 a national holiday
attributes.background: As the 11th of November 2018 will be the centenary of the end of the Great War (WW1) I believe as a make of respect the whole of the UK should have a national holiday to remember the fallen.

attributes.action: issue an apology  to homosexuals who were criminalised  under indecency laws
attributes.background: Lives have been ruined, aspirations destroyed by cruel laws , in the armed forces men were unjustly punished for the crime of falling in love with another man,blacklisted as sex offenders a status that for years hung like a shadow , causing pain ,hurt ,mental health issues and astricisation

attributes.action: Give English People a vote on if we want Scotland to be given independence.
attributes.background: We keep hearing how Scotland wants its independence and how harsh it is being a part of the United Kingdom.
attributes.additional_details: Give English People a vote on if we want Scotland to be given independence.We keep hearing how Scotland wants its independence and how harsh it is being a part of the United Kingdom. As well as how unfairly Scotland is treated buy the rest of the UK they seem to forget about all the English money that is used to help and support Scotland. So i propose we have a show of hands to see how many people in the rest of the UK would want to become separated from Scotland. I think that Scotland would be shocked at the result of this partition

attributes.action: Make Wildlife/ natural history a compulsory part of the national curriculum
attributes.background: Wildlife around the globe is decreasing at a ferocious rate, not just oversea but on our very own soil. By educating generations about the value of wildlife, the ecosystem and what animals do for us, only then will the world halt the decline in our amazing Wildlife.
attributes.additional_details:
An audit of more than 200 native species - including birds, bats, moths, butterflies, hares and dormice - shows that priority species have declined on average by 58% since 1970 - The guardian

 “The natural world is in serious trouble and it needs our help as never before.”  Sir David Attenborough

attributes.action: Do not impose the Bedroom Tax on Pensioners
attributes.background: Pensioners have paid Taxes all their working lives now in their latter years with low state Pensions cannot afford to pay an unfair cut in Housing Benefit which is another form of Poll Tax.
attributes.additional_details: The Tory Government is soon to impose the Bedroom Tax on Pensioners by cutting Housing Benefit to OAPS that have extra bedrooms they say people don't use. Some couples need to sleep alone because of different ailments they have so need the extra bedroom, there is not enough Social Housing to rehouse everybody its Social Blackmail which is not Fair on people who have paid Taxes all their working lives and are about to be hit with an unfair Tax in their Twilight Years when they don't need the worry of it all

attributes.action: Hinckley power station should be funded by the UK.
attributes.background: The country is asking foreign powers to provide and control our nuclear power. The rates of interest on the money put up is 9% and the guaranteed rate for electricity produced is such that we will suffer  from higher energy prices.
attributes.additional_details: Savers cannot obtain virtually any interest on their savings. They should be offered the opportunity of funding the project secured by the government at a rate of half that demanded by the French and Chinese. This would nevertheless allow them to invest in a project needed by the country but offering them  a reasonable return on their capital.

attributes.action: Keep present allowances for disabled and assisted accomodation tenants.
attributes.background: The present efforts by the government to attack the poorest and most vulnerable in our society must stop.I work with both the disabled and the homeless who do not have a voice. Help me and sign this petition to be their voice.
attributes.additional_details: Rental allowances from benefit are capped and often fall short of the required amount- which then has to be topped up from benefits- often leaving individuals with less than £60 a week for all their needs (food, toiletries, transport, household goods etc) This is inhuman treatment of the most vulnerable in our society who need our help and support.The allowances should be kept and increased yearly in line with the cost of living index.

attributes.action: Increase wage for qualified level 3 nursery assistants and early years educators
attributes.background: Nursery assistants and early years educators follow the same EYFS targets as a reception class teacher. We are now required to have specified knowledge of children's learning and development. It is no longer 'just' childcare. We are teachers.
attributes.additional_details: Nursery Assistants and early years educators perform a similar job to that of a reception class teacher. We must ensure children are learning and developing at a rate deemed age appropriate. We must carry out rergular assessments on the children, and facilitate learning environments and activities based on each individual childs needs. We need to have in depth knowledge of the Early Years Foundation Stage and are usually required to be qualified.

attributes.action: Bring in a law to stop any more buildings over 30 floors being built in London.
attributes.background: London isn't Manhattan. Our original environment is dwarfed by mega-towers that no-one lives in. Let's ask the Government to bring in planning law to prevent any more towers over 30 floors being built in Central London. Those extra floors aren't solving any housing crisis - just overseas investors
attributes.additional_details:
Guardian article on 50 story St George's Wharf tower - the blight of Vauxhall riverside: 
https://www.theguardian.com/society/2016/may/24/revealed-foreign-buyers-own-two-thirds-of-tower-st-george-wharf-london
This Ipsos mori survey for Skyline Campaign suggests that lots of people agree with me: 
http://workplaceinsight.net/majority-of-londoners-support-greater-restrictions-on-new-tall-buildings/

attributes.action: Change E.S.A back to Incapacity benefit
attributes.background: I believe the current policies regarding ESA are wrong and unreasonable to the extent that the long term sick, are sick and not able to work, the decision to put the sick into work makes no sense as the illnesses are still there and there is no work for long term sufferers.

attributes.action: Introduce an extra £1 per week from tax payers to fund the NHS after BREXIT
attributes.background: I paid my taxes since leaving school in 1987 and never needed the NHS, but after having a Stroke in 2016 have realised how valuable and amazing our NHS and its staff are. I propose a £1 per week tax to help increase staff wages and encourage new employees. We have something special let's keep it.
attributes.additional_details: Queens Hospital, Romford, Essex

attributes.action: Make tobacco/cigarettes illegal in the UK
attributes.background: Tobacco has been proven to have a plethora of negatives effects on the health. If the government/'experts' have the audacity to ban cannabis for its effects even with the added benefit, tobacco/cigarettes should also be banned with the lack of benefits of smoking it.

attributes.action: Fund courses for people with ill mental health to help them get back into work
attributes.background: I know a number of individuals who suffer ill mental health, and getting a job is hard enough for the people who don't. We need to come up with the sort of help that doesn't just include how to survive, but a course which helps continue skills to fight ill mental health while getting back to work.
attributes.additional_details: We need this because going through the job process is very hard, people with mental health issues get help while in the deep of their situations, then when they are finished get shoved away onto job seekers and left to deal with their life. There is no support in North east Essex which stands with an individual to the moment they are excepted for a job. There is no obvious help which extends the skills to fight mental illness while the job process happens. Sometimes we all need a little help.

attributes.action: Lift the ban of Pit bulls and other dogs affected by BSL in the UK
attributes.background: Many innocent breeds of dogs have been banned from the UK on grounds of them being dangerous - but the animals aren't dangerous and I refuse to allow the government to ban an innocent animal purely because of previous criminal owners forcing them into violence
attributes.additional_details: I know many people are aware of BSL (Breed Specific Legislation) making specifics breeds of dogs banned purely because they could be deemed as dangerous, but I bet you didn't know that in 2015, Jack Russels were the breed most likely to bite in the city of Liverpool (according to police in Liverpool). Furthermore, your household best friend - the Labrador - is also responsible for the highest number of canine attacks according to the pet insurers Animal Friends.

attributes.action: A parking bay should have legal standard size of 3 meters
attributes.background: Parking bays are too small and you can't get out you car once parked. I'm disabled and find it hard to get out my car when I can't find a disabled parking bay, because they're all taken. I'd like to see a legal minimum size bay of 3 meters since most car parks charge

attributes.action: Fine parents who refuse to vaccinate children
attributes.background: Vaccines have been repeatedly proven effective. Parents who refuse them are costing the NHS money and endangering to lives of vulnerable people worldwide. If heavy fines were in place this would negate those loses and prevent people carelessly making that choice.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.nhs.uk/Conditions/vaccinations/Pages/benefits-and-risks.aspx

https://www.cdc.gov/vaccines/hcp/conversations/downloads/talk-infants-color-office.pdf

attributes.action: Save Southport A&E hospital
attributes.background:
Southport A&E hospital is on a list for closing. Think about it..... if you or your family needed emergency care where and how long would it take to get there never mind about being in the nhs queue to receive treatment. 
Please help everyone you know. Let's save southport A&E!!!!!!!

attributes.action: Develop a train service from Sheerness to Leysdown
attributes.background: The isle of Sheppey has recently seen a huge development in Neatscourt retail park near Queenborough, but the infrastructure has not been developed to allow residents from perhaps Leysdown to access it. If there was a train with multiple stops across the island, people would access its shops easier.

attributes.action: Introduce and enforce a trade embargo on Saudi Arabia.
attributes.background: Saudi Arabia have an appalling human rights record. Homosexual acts are punishable by death and women are treated legally as second class citizens. In addition to their medieval society, there is evidence that the Saudi regime funds Sunni terrorists organisations. We cannot do business with them.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/saudi-arabia/local-laws-and-customs
"The Saudi legal system differs in many ways from the UK. Suspects can be held without charge and are not always allowed quick access to legal representation. The Saudi authorities have detained witnesses and victims of crimes."
"It is illegal for women to drive."
"The public practice of any form of religion other than Islam is illegal"

attributes.action: Introduce 100% Inheritance Tax At £10 Million
attributes.background: Don’t you wish to see the gap between the ultra-rich and the poor begin to narrow, instead of constantly widening? How can we even begin creating an even playing field where equal opportunity exists for everyone, while the colossal gap between privilege and poverty stares us in the face every day?
attributes.additional_details:
If no-one could pass on more than £10 million total to be divided between their heirs, we would see the gap between the rich and poor begin to narrow for the first time. 

A New Graded System could look like this :
40% IT payable after £750,000
50% IT payable after £1 million
60% IT payable after £2. 5 million
70% IT payable after £5 million
85% IT payable after £7. 5 million
100% IT payable after £10 million

100% IT could help properly fund the NHS, Education, Housing, Etc…  Please support it!

attributes.action: All new members of the House of Lords should sit for 10 years
attributes.background:
The present House of Lords has been a mockery for many many years.viz Iolanthe written in the 1800s. Major reform is unlikely. However my minor change would, in due time, reduce the numbers.
It should not be difficult to make this change.

attributes.action: New generation social housing policy
attributes.background: It is an issue close to many of our hearts that too many people are without affordable and safe accommodation. That as a country we are not doing enough to provide affordable housing, specialist housing units for under 25's, mother and baby units for our future generations.
attributes.additional_details:
We are campaigning for a new policy dictating:-

- Housing to be provided only to those with 10+ years in the UK
- New Decent Homes Standards
- Rent assessed on affordability with a baseline on each property
- Annual property reviews including tenancy and accommodation
- New Tenancy Groups which deal with localised property repair issues
- More specialised properties including low rent properties, young peoples living, over 50's & mother and baby units
- New Housing Officer Role & Training

attributes.action: A better awareness of endometriosis within NHS and treatments available.
attributes.background: It can take years to diagnose condition, lack of understanding and knowledge within communities, more information and support available for sufferers, it may not be cancer but this is a slow crippling disease affecting your body and mind.

attributes.action: Increase NI contributions and % of Gov. spending to meet the demands of the NHS.
attributes.background: The BBC were allowed into A&E depart. of the Royal Blackburn Hospital to witness the desperation of both patients and staff over a week. More investment in staff and accommodation was suggested by a consultant as a way forward. We should pay more for this invaluable institution which we all use.

attributes.action: Use our "special relationship" to persuade Trump to release his tax returns now.
attributes.background: The ordinary man has to pay tax, and has no choice in the matter. President Trump, as the leader of the free world, should set the example. He has claimed he paid millions in taxes, but has never proved it - Now he is president he should release his tax returns to back up his claims.

attributes.action: Add Welsh language education to the English school curriculum.
attributes.background: The Welsh language is spoken throughout both Wales and England and is arguably the native language of Great Britain, as well as 500,000 people. However, in England, the opportunity to learn Welsh is practically impossible.
attributes.additional_details: Give Welsh has an option in English schools to help promote cultural understand, give more people access to their ancestral language, help keep this magnificent language alive and create job opportunities for Welsh-speakers in England.

attributes.action: Invoice embassies based in the U.K. for NHS costs incurred by health tourists
attributes.background: The NHS is in danger of collapse. It cannot afford to treat people who come to the U.K. for healthcare and then refuse to pay for their treatment which often runs into hundreds of thousands of pounds. I believe that the country of origin should be held responsible and be made to pay.
attributes.additional_details: A recent documentary highlighted three cases, a woman from the Philipines who needed a quadruple heart bypass, a Turkish man in a similar situation and a woman who had fertility treatment abroad and after being refused entry to the USA, came to the U.K. and ran up a bill of over £300,000 at a London hospital. Three cases, almost £1,000,000 which will never be repaid and could be better spent on staff, services and equipment to treat people who qualify.

attributes.action: Accept 10,000 refugee families into the UK, instead of Donald Trump
attributes.background: Accept 10000 Vulnerable refugee families into the UK and settle them using the money That would be otherwise spent on Trumps state visit
attributes.additional_details: Accept 10,000 vulnerable refugee families with children into the uk, instead of having Donald Trump here for a state visit. The money we would spend on hosting Trump to be used to bring over / settle the refugee families into UK city's, help them to learn English and find jobs while accepting and embracing their culture

attributes.action: Ban petitions calling for a ban on visits by heads of state invited by UK Govt
attributes.background: The media is full of 'news' on petitions calling for heads of states which have been invited by the UK Government to visit to be banned from visiting. This is a waste of resources and time, obviously the UK Govt has deemed it right that these people are invited in the first place.

attributes.action: Ensure that a trade deal with the EU is a priority over a trade deal with the US
attributes.background: The PM is discussing trade deals with the US, the party have given the impression that a trade deal with the US will be a substitute for the current trade deal with the European Union. Many jobs and business rely on the current EU trade deal and would gain no benefit from a trade deal with the USA.

attributes.action: Ban the use of Body Mass Index (BMI) as a measure of obesity by NHS
attributes.background: Set in 1830 by a non-medical mathematician and astronomer, BMI is an inaccurate measure of body fat content and does not take into account muscle mass, bone density, overall body composition, racial and sex differences. When Johnny Wilkinson won the RWC he was officially overweight according to BMI.
attributes.additional_details: There is an urgent need for accurate tools to measure fat and skeletal muscle, and biomarkers that can better predict the risks of diseases and mortality. Advances to improve the measurement of obesity and related factors will help determine the optimal weight for an individual, taking into account factors such as age, sex, genetics, fitness, pre-existing diseases, as well as novel blood markers and metabolic parameters altered by obesity. (Ahima and Lazar, Science, August 2013)

attributes.action: Every UK pet owner/breeder/pet to be registered or £1000 fine given.
attributes.background: Reduce the number of reported/unreported animal abuse cases via strict registration laws. Owners would need to take their pet to a registration office within a week of getting the animal. Simple DNA sample to be taken from animal. Incentives for people who suspect an animal/owner is not registered.
